### Reading, Converting, Analyzing and Plotting Clock Bmal1 
### Fold Changes in Rats 
#### Reading in Clock Bmal1 Administered Rat Data for 
#### LD and rLEN
```{r}
# Reading Clock Bmal1 Administered Rats
readxl::read_excel(path ="../SCN PCR Data Summary.xlsx",
                   sheet = "Bmal1",
                    range ="A1:M40") ->  Circadian_Clock_Bmal1

Circadian_Clock_Bmal1 %>%
  select(`Animal ID`,`Time point`, `Group`, `Normalized fold change`) %>%
  rename("ID" = `Animal ID`, "Time" = `Time point`,
        "Change" = `Normalized fold change`)-> Circadian_Clock_Bmal1


# Check if 'Normalized fold change' is character and needs parsing
if (is.character(Circadian_Clock_Bmal1$Change)) {
  Circadian_Clock_Bmal1 <- Circadian_Clock_Bmal1 %>%
    mutate(Change = parse_number(Change))
}

# Separating LD data and pivoting
Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_LD <- Circadian_Clock_Bmal1 %>%
  filter(grepl("LD", Group)) %>%
  mutate(
    Time = recode(Time,
    "ZT0" = "0", "ZT6" = "6", "ZT12" = "12", "ZT18" = "18", "ZT24" = "24")
  ) %>%
  pivot_wider(
    id_cols = ID,
    names_from = Time,
    values_from = Change) %>%
  select(-c(ID))
if (!"24" %in% colnames(Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_LD)) {
  LD_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter <- Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_LD %>%
    mutate(`24` = `0`)}

# Separating rLEN data and pivoting    
Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_rLEN <- Circadian_Clock_Bmal1 %>%
  filter(grepl("rLEN", Group)) %>%
  mutate(
    Time = recode(Time,
    "ZT0" = "0", "ZT6" = "6", "ZT12" = "12", "ZT18" = "18", "ZT24" = "24")
  ) %>%
  pivot_wider(
    id_cols = ID,
    names_from = Time,
    values_from = Change)%>%
  select(-c(ID))
if (!"24" %in% colnames(Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_rLEN)) {
  rLEN_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter <- Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_rLEN %>%
    mutate(`24` = `0`)}
  
```


#### Converting Data into Usable Format for Extracting VOIs and Plotting
```{r}
# Data Conversion to get Individual Points for LD Clock Bmal1 
# Rat Model
## X value is Zeitgeber time, Y value is # of Fold Changes

# Loads Initial Dataset for LD Clock Bmal1 Rats and 
# Removes Outliers
#outlier_detection(Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_LD) -> out_res_LDCBmal1
#filter_outliers(Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_LD, 
#                out_res_LDCBmal1) ->  LD_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter

# Performs Data Carpentry on Filtered LD TNFa Dataset and Removes 'NA's,
## filters out ZT of 24
LD_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = c(`0`,`6`,`12`, `18`, `24`), names_to = "ZT", 
               values_to = "Fold_Changes") %>%
  drop_na(`Fold_Changes`) %>%
  mutate(ZT = as.numeric(ZT)) %>%
  arrange(ZT) -> LD_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter
LD_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter %>%
  # Filter out ZT of 24
  filter(ZT != 24)  -> LD_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_data

# Creating Cosinor Model for LD TNFa Rat Plots
cosinor.lm(`Fold_Changes` ~ time(ZT), period = 24,
           data = LD_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter) -> cosMod_LD_CBmal1
# Creating Cosinor Model for LD TNFa Rat Data Analysis
cosinor.lm(`Fold_Changes` ~ time(ZT), period = 24,
           data = LD_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_data) -> cosMod_LD_CBmal1_data
```

```{r}
# Data Conversion to get Individual Points for rLEN Clock Bmal1 
# Rat Model X value is Zeitgeber time, Y value is # of Fold Changes

# Loads Initial Dataset for rLEN Clock Bmal1 Rats and Removes Outliers
#outlier_detection(Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_rLEN) -> out_res_rLENCBmal1
#filter_outliers(Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_rLEN, 
#                out_res_rLENCBmal1) ->  rLEN_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter

# Performs Data Carpentry on Filtered LD TNFa Dataset and Removes 'NA's
rLEN_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = c(`0`,`6`,`12`, `18`, `24`), names_to = "ZT", 
               values_to = "Fold_Changes") %>%
  drop_na(`Fold_Changes`) %>%
  mutate(ZT = as.numeric(ZT)) %>%
  arrange(ZT) -> rLEN_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter
rLEN_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter %>%
  # Filter out ZT of 24
  filter(ZT != 24)  -> rLEN_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_data

# Creating Cosinor Model for LD TNFa Rat Plots
cosinor.lm(`Fold_Changes` ~ time(ZT), period = 24,
           data = rLEN_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter) -> cosMod_rLEN_CBmal1
# Creating Cosinor Model for LD TNFa Rat Plot Data Analysis
cosinor.lm(`Fold_Changes` ~ time(ZT), period = 24,
           data = rLEN_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_data) -> cosMod_rLEN_CBmal1_data
```


#### Calculating the Y-limits for Plots of Cosinor Fit
```{r}
# Finding the max Y-value Across Both Datsets in Order to Set Y-limits of 
# Future Plot
max(rLEN_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter$`Fold_Changes`, 
    LD_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter$`Fold_Changes`) -> CBmal1_max
# Calculate y_peak based on CBmal1_max
if (CBmal1_max < 3) {
  y_peak <- ceiling(CBmal1_max / 0.25) * 0.25 
  } else {
  y_peak <- ceiling(CBmal1_max / 5) * 5}
```


#### Creating Plots of Original Data with Cosinor Fit Overlayed for Rat Models
```{r}
# Creating Individual Plots of Rat Datasets w/ Cosinor Fits
## Loads Function plot_cosinor_clock Into Global Environment, Which Takes cosMod 
## Model, Original Dataset, Plot Title and Desired x-breaks (currently set for
## Zetigeber Time, to see how to change to regular time see function notes) and
## Generates Plot of Original Data with Overlayed Cosinor Fit Model

# Creating Plot for LD TNFa Rat Model
plot_cosinor_clock(cosMod_LD_CBmal1, LD_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter, 
             "LD Clock Bmal1", "LD",
             x_breaks = seq(0, 24, by = 6)) -> mod_plot_LD_CBmal1


# Creating Plot for rLEN TNFa Rat Model
plot_cosinor_clock(cosMod_rLEN_CBmal1, rLEN_Circadian_Clock_Bmal1_Filter, 
             "rLEN Clock Bmal1", "rLEN",
             x_breaks = seq(0, 24, by = 6)) -> mod_plot_rLEN_CBmal1
```

#### Creating Side-by-Side Plot Comparison of Cosinor Fit Models for LD and 
#### rLEN Rat Models
```{r, fig.width= 15}

# Create the directory if it does not exist

# Save the plot as PDF in the specified directory
```
